author: Catie Low
title: Domino's reveals soaring profits amid concerns over worker underpayment
text:
Dominos CEO Don Meij: "I make no apologies for expecting the highest standards from our franchisees." Photo: Chris Hyde 
Sales across its network of pizza stores punched through $1 billion for the first time, driving a 21.1 per cent increase in the group's overall revenue to $539.4 million 
Domino's chief executive Don Meij said the company had zero tolerance for unethical behaviour including underpayment of wages or under-reporting of sales. Related Content The high real cost of those cut-price pizzas 
"I make no apologies for expecting the highest standards from our franchisees," Mr Meij said 
"Due to our investment in proactive compliance we have identified some franchisees who have wilfully breached their obligations to team members." 
Meij made his comments after a Fairfax Media investigation into the company and its franchisees uncovered widespread underpayment of wages, the deliberate underpayment of penalties using a delivery scam and the illegal sale of sponsorships of migrants for as much as $150,000.
